coverAlt: Illustration of a futuristic cityscape with digital elements
title: Snow Crash
subTitle: A Novel
author: Neal Stephenson

coverAlt: An illustration of a big man with a big bird on his head
title: A Confederacy of Dunces
author: John Kennedy Toole
description: Picked this up on my University Bookstore shelf. Its a reward for all that academic reading. It was a good choice because I love new orleans and it is laugh-till-you-hurt funny.

coverAlt: An illustration of a chamaeleon or maybe an iguana
title: Adaptive Web Design
subTitle: Crafting Rich Experiences with Progressive Enhancement
author: Aaron Gustafson

coverAlt: An illustration of a chamaeleon or maybe an iguana
title: Modern Romance
author: Aziz Ansari with Eric Klinenberg

coverAlt: A futuristic city, but its made out of trailors stacked on top of each other
title: Ready Player One
author: Ernest Cline

coverAlt: A cut-up collage that looks futuristic
title: The Electric Information Age Book
subTitle: McLuhan/Agel/Fiore and the Experimental Paperback
author: Jeffrey Schnapp, Adam Michaels
description: Sometimes I want to put books on here because the cover looks cool. Interestingly I also have the record soundtrack that this one comes with. It's weird too.

coverAlt: A graphic cover with a collage of numbers and angled typography
title: Commercial Specimen of Typefaces
description: I have used Dala Prisma in a previous design project for a wine label. I should use more of these typefaces.

coverAlt: A photograph of a woman recliing and looking up
title: The Great Discontent
subTitle: Issue 1
author: Various Authors

coverAlt: A headless man in a coat and tie
title: We Are Anonymous
subTitle: Inside the Hacker World of LulzSec, Anonymous, and the Global Cyber Insurgency
author: Parmy Olson
description: This was on the top of my reading list when I started in the cybersecurity department. It really helped me undestand a lot of the lingo. So something that sounded silly, like script kiddie or DDoS, actually made scense. its also a really good narative – why isn't it a movie yet?

coverAlt: A film reel looking set of portraits of famous people
title: 100 New Yorkers
subTitle: A guide to the Illustrious Lives & Locations
author: Julia Holmes
description: When I first moved to NYC I read a lot of local history. There is so many great titles in the genre. You should have seen the evening that our local pub trivia had a round on NYC History. My teammates lost their mind with what I knew. They did not know how many books a podcasts I had consumed.

coverAlt: Illustration of a traveler's journey through historical and cultural  landmarks
title: The Sinner's Grand Tour
subTitle: A Journey Through The Historical Underbelly of Europe
author: Ian Thomson
description: I used to go to this travel writer meetup called Restless Legs. A friend of mine, Josh, and I would watch the website and meet up in the basement of a bar. These writers would read from their novel. The best ones wouldn't read but just tell us one of the stories of travel. I really miss that series and I'm going to google it now to see if it is ever coming back. This is another great example of how meeting the author

coverAlt: A cover that looks like a secret document folder, the stamp Declassified is on the front
title: The Official C.I.A. Manual of Trickery and Deception
author: H. Keith Melton, Robert Wallace

coverAlt: Illustration of a runner standing on a trail with a scenic background
title: Born to Run
subTitle: A Hidden Tribe, Superathletes, and the Greatest Race the World Ha  Never Seen
author: Christopher McDougall
description: I once did a meetup with the author and ran barefoot around prospect park. It wasn't that bad!

coverAlt: An arial shot of a highway artery
title: How They Got There
subTitle: Interviews with Digital Designers About Their Career Journeys
author: Khoi Vinh

coverAlt: Illustration of a cityscape with artistic and experimental elements including arrows and military figures
title: The Situationist City
author: Simon Sadler
description: I was gifted this book, or more like long-term borrowed, when I was doing an art show called Caught Mapping. A lot of the elements of that show like navigation and mapping of urban landscapes.

coverAlt: An illustration of a nebula in space with the constallations of cancer and Aries
title: Zodiac Series
subTitle: Beware the 13th Sign
author: Romina Garber

coverAlt: A simple illustration of circles that looks like an atom with one nucleus and one electron
title: Atomic Design
author: Brad Frost
description: I picked up my signed copy of this book at an event with the author. When I had him sign it I asked for him to mention that my copy would be for corporate libary use only and he got a really big kick out of that.

coverAlt: Apparently the 12th A Book Apart title with a forward by Austin Kleon
title: You’re My Favorite Client
author: Mike Monteiro

coverAlt: Apparently the 16th A Book Apart title with a forward by Frank Chimero
title: Going Responsive

coverAlt: Apparently the 22nd A Book Apart title with a forward by Kim Goodwin
